alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 09 at 1:27AM MST until February 09 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 6 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-25. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although snowfall is expected to taper off in the afternoon, strong winds resulting in reduced visibilities in blowing snow will continue.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
